issue.title: chore: fix core vsix on windows
issue.body:
### What does this PR do?
Add the older jsforce as a dep of the core extension.  This is a sad work around to the issue found where VSCode 1.83.1 isn't loading modules correctly

Downsides: 
- one more install of jsforce in the core extension 
- Inflates the core extension by another 5mb or so


### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
@W-14374832@ 
#5187

### Functionality Before
vsix fails to start on windows

### Functionality After
vsix works on windows

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,6 +5,15 @@ lang: en
 
 The Local Development Server is a Salesforce CLI plug-in that configures and runs a Lightning Web Components-enabled server on your computer. You can develop Lightning web components and see live changes without publishing the components to an org.
 
+**Note**: This plugin does not support the following features:
+- `@AuraEnabled` Apex methods
+- `CSS` custom properties
+- `LightningModal`
+- `lwc:if`, `lwc:elseif`, and `lwc:els`e directives

pull_request.title: docs: Add warning message to lwc-local-dev
pull_request.body:
<!--- PR title should follow the pattern: <type>(optional scope): <description>.
please refer to the types and format here: https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#summary
If this is a feat/fix, add the technical writer as a reviewer to the PR. --->

### What does this PR do?

This update to warn potential users on the limitations of the LWC Local Dev Server and request they provide feedback on the issue.

### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
This PR references the request for feedback on the LWC Local Dev Server and issues that prevent it from working.
#5165

issue.title: Suppress output tab setting
issue.body:
<!--- PR title should follow the pattern: <type>(optional scope): <description>.
please refer to the types and format here: https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#summary
If this is a feat/fix, add the technical writer as a reviewer to the PR. --->

### What does this PR do?

Added a setting that will suppress output on deploy/retreive

### What issues does this PR fix or reference?

#4970

### Functionality Before

no such setting. Messages is constantly opening bottom panel and irritating users

### Functionality After

Peace and calm after you enable it.

comment.body:
Hi @gonardfreeman,
Our team is actually in the process of phasing out the integration tests, so it's ok if your test doesn't work.  I was going to push a commit to revert it but it seems like you got there to make the fix before me. 🙂 If the integration tests continue to fail, please go ahead and revert it.

We do need more unit test coverage on this PR, so since you're in the effort of creating tests, please redirect your efforts to increasing test coverage there.  Thanks.

pull_request.title: chore: fix core vsix on windows
pull_request.body:
### What does this PR do?
Add the older jsforce as a dep of the core extension.  This is a sad work around to the issue found where VSCode 1.83.1 isn't loading modules correctly

Downsides: 
- one more install of jsforce in the core extension 
- Inflates the core extension by another 5mb or so


### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
@W-14374832@

### Functionality Before
vsix fails to start on windows

### Functionality After
vsix works on windows

comment.body: Note this is in the packageUpdates property.  These are deps that are directly installed b/c they can't be bundled.  In this case we are ensuring that the version of sf-core in the @heroku/functions/core dependancy finds the right version of jsforce.

issue.title: Release 59.2.0 Core extension fails to activate on Windows
issue.body:
### Summary

In release test of the v59.2.0 release it was found that the core extension will not activate when: 
- On Windows 
- Using VSCode version 1.83.1 (works on 1.81.1) 

### Steps To Reproduce:
- Install core extension from the [v59.2.0](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/releases/tag/v59.2.0) Release 


### Additional information

![Screenshot 2023-10-26 at 12 46 20 AM](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/76090802/1be4cc9a-d6fc-4f5f-8c77-4596187c5a3e)


**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**: v59.2.0

**SFDX CLI Version**: N/A

**OS and version**: Windows 

**VS Code version**: 1.83.1

comment.body: This issue has been linked to a new work item: W-14374832

issue.title: Unable to authorize an org
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli
-->

### Summary
I GET BELOW ERROR WHEN I TRY TO AUTHORISE ORG
TypeError: shellPath.at is not a function

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. CREATE A PROJECT WITH MANIFEST
2. AUTHORIZE AN ORG

### Expected result
It should have redirected to a web page to authorise an org

### Actual result
Getting below error
TypeError: shellPath.at is not a function

### Additional information

![image](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/108812920/b459f5ee-39e7-4232-98eb-7a57bb1f9946)

**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**: 59.1.2

**SFDX CLI Version**: 2.14.6

**OS and version**: mac OS Ventura 13.5

**VS Code version**: 1.83

comment.body: Hi @nkl14, could you please open your command palette, run `Developer: Show Running Extensions` and send me a screenshot?

issue.title: Deploy Source to org command takes several minutes to complete
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli
-->

### Summary

We have noticed that when using the "deploy source to org" command from the command palette, the notification that the action in running does not close even though the deployment has already completed in the backgroud. This give a wrong impression that the deployment takes several several minutes to complete. Some times the deployed to source message gets printed twice even though the command was run only once.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a new project or take an existing one and connect it to an org of your choosing.
1. Do a change to a lightning web component
1. Run the "deploy source to org" command

### Expected result

Success message for the deployment and the list of deployed components should appear in a second or two

### Actual result

Success message takes several minutes to appear. Sometimes the command in progress notificaiton keeps running even though list of deployed components has already been printed.

### Additional information
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/662e8d4e-8dda-4c29-8cbc-507170164aa3)

Here's an example when deployed to source gets printed twitch even though the command is run only once
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/f9265c54-8174-4165-95f6-ca28b67d14b9)

**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**:
v57.13.1

**SFDX CLI Version**:
@salesforce/cli/1.78.0 darwin-x64 node-v18.15.0

**OS and version**:
MacOS Ventura 13.3.1

comment.body: > > Hello! Just wanted to know if you all have the `Apex Setting: Perform Synchronous Compile on Deploy` (which you can find **in your org settings**, in setup) enabled, and if so try: > > > > * disable setting > > * go to vscode and reauth to your org > > * reload vscode > > > > and see if it helps > > Also, we want to know if the slow deployment happens to all your orgs or if it's ok with a new one > > We're asking all these q's because disabling the setting or working with a new org has fixed it for some users. And of course disabling our vscode setting: `Salesforcedx-vscode-core > Experimental: Enable Source Tracking For Deploy And Retrieve` (and reloading vscode window after) > > Thanks again for your patience and sorry for all the inconveniences this has caused > > Hi @tadahh, @kenny-buckles, have you tried these workarounds? Hey @CristiCanizales, Yes `Apex Setting: Perform Synchronous Compile on Deploy` is disabled Yes `Salesforcedx-vscode-core > Experimental: Enable Source Tracking For Deploy And Retrieve` is disabled I have tried everything I could find on the internet. This issue is for an existing dev sandbox we refresh every couple months.

issue.title: Deploy Source to org command takes several minutes to complete
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli
-->

### Summary

We have noticed that when using the "deploy source to org" command from the command palette, the notification that the action in running does not close even though the deployment has already completed in the backgroud. This give a wrong impression that the deployment takes several several minutes to complete. Some times the deployed to source message gets printed twice even though the command was run only once.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a new project or take an existing one and connect it to an org of your choosing.
1. Do a change to a lightning web component
1. Run the "deploy source to org" command

### Expected result

Success message for the deployment and the list of deployed components should appear in a second or two

### Actual result

Success message takes several minutes to appear. Sometimes the command in progress notificaiton keeps running even though list of deployed components has already been printed.

### Additional information
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/662e8d4e-8dda-4c29-8cbc-507170164aa3)

Here's an example when deployed to source gets printed twitch even though the command is run only once
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/f9265c54-8174-4165-95f6-ca28b67d14b9)

**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**:
v57.13.1

**SFDX CLI Version**:
@salesforce/cli/1.78.0 darwin-x64 node-v18.15.0

**OS and version**:
MacOS Ventura 13.3.1

comment.body:
> Hello! Just wanted to know if you all have the `Apex Setting: Perform Synchronous Compile on Deploy` (which you can find **in your org settings**, in setup) enabled, and if so try:
> 
> * disable setting
> * go to vscode and reauth to your org
> * reload vscode
> 
> and see if it helps
> 
> Also, we want to know if the slow deployment happens to all your orgs or if it's ok with a new one
> 
> We're asking all these q's because disabling the setting or working with a new org has fixed it for some users. And of course disabling our vscode setting: `Salesforcedx-vscode-core > Experimental: Enable Source Tracking For Deploy And Retrieve` (and reloading vscode window after)
> 
> Thanks again for your patience and sorry for all the inconveniences this has caused

Hi @tadahh, @kenny-buckles, have you tried these workarounds?

issue.title: Deploy Source to org command takes several minutes to complete
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli

### Summary

We have noticed that when using the "deploy source to org" command from the command palette, the notification that the action in running does not close even though the deployment has already completed in the backgroud. This give a wrong impression that the deployment takes several several minutes to complete. Some times the deployed to source message gets printed twice even though the command was run only once.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a new project or take an existing one and connect it to an org of your choosing.
1. Do a change to a lightning web component
1. Run the "deploy source to org" command

### Expected result

Success message for the deployment and the list of deployed components should appear in a second or two

issue.title: Deploy Source to org command takes several minutes to complete
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli
-->

### Summary

We have noticed that when using the "deploy source to org" command from the command palette, the notification that the action in running does not close even though the deployment has already completed in the backgroud. This give a wrong impression that the deployment takes several several minutes to complete. Some times the deployed to source message gets printed twice even though the command was run only once.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a new project or take an existing one and connect it to an org of your choosing.
1. Do a change to a lightning web component
1. Run the "deploy source to org" command

### Expected result

Success message for the deployment and the list of deployed components should appear in a second or two

### Actual result

Success message takes several minutes to appear. Sometimes the command in progress notificaiton keeps running even though list of deployed components has already been printed.

### Additional information
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/662e8d4e-8dda-4c29-8cbc-507170164aa3)

Here's an example when deployed to source gets printed twitch even though the command is run only once
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/f9265c54-8174-4165-95f6-ca28b67d14b9)

**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**:
v57.13.1

**SFDX CLI Version**:
@salesforce/cli/1.78.0 darwin-x64 node-v18.15.0

**OS and version**:
MacOS Ventura 13.3.1

comment.body: Hi all, thanks for sharing the issue you're running into! We'll have a member of our team take a closer look at what might be going on cc @gbockus-sf

issue.title: Deploy Source to org command takes several minutes to complete
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli
-->

### Summary

We have noticed that when using the "deploy source to org" command from the command palette, the notification that the action in running does not close even though the deployment has already completed in the backgroud. This give a wrong impression that the deployment takes several several minutes to complete. Some times the deployed to source message gets printed twice even though the command was run only once.

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. Create a new project or take an existing one and connect it to an org of your choosing.
1. Do a change to a lightning web component
1. Run the "deploy source to org" command

### Expected result

Success message for the deployment and the list of deployed components should appear in a second or two

### Actual result

Success message takes several minutes to appear. Sometimes the command in progress notificaiton keeps running even though list of deployed components has already been printed.

### Additional information
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/662e8d4e-8dda-4c29-8cbc-507170164aa3)

Here's an example when deployed to source gets printed twitch even though the command is run only once
![kuva](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/51646225/f9265c54-8174-4165-95f6-ca28b67d14b9)

**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**:
v57.13.1

**SFDX CLI Version**:
@salesforce/cli/1.78.0 darwin-x64 node-v18.15.0

**OS and version**:
MacOS Ventura 13.3.1

comment.body: We as a development team are also facing the same issues. I have personally uninstalled the cli and all extensions and reinstalled node, npm, cli, and the vscode extension pack to latest versions. We are seeing conflict detection sitting stale for 20+ mins and every once in a while I will receive the below error

pull_request.title: Run e2e against vsixes
pull_request.body:
### What does this PR do?
Refactors e2e testing framework to test against vsixes and not against the source code.
- Unschedules e2e workflows and schedule buildAll.yml which creates the vsixes and calls e2e to test them. This can also be triggered on demand for a given branch
- Removes file testSlackWorkflow.yml which is not used
- Updates runE2ETest.yml to use vsixes from given run instead of source code

### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
@W-14182445@

### Functionality Before
- Testing against source code

### Functionality After
- Testing against vsixes from given run

## Notes:
This will go in together with the PR in the e2e repo: https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode-automation-tests/pull/53

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -29,6 +33,17 @@ jobs:
         with:
           path: ./salesforcedx-vscode
           ref: ${{ github.event.ref }}
+      - name: Download extension vsixes
+        run: |
+          mkdir ./extensions
+          pwd
+          gh run download ${{ inputs.runId }} -D ./extensions
comment.body: Just calling out for future us using gh here means the run with the artifacts has to have already been completed.

issue.title: Unable to authorize an org
issue.body:
<!--
NOTICE: While GitHub is the preferred channel for reporting issues/feedback, this is not a mechanism for receiving support under any agreement or SLA. If you require immediate assistance, please use official support channels.
-->

<!--
FOR BUGS RELATED TO THE SALEFORCE CLI, please use this repository: https://github.com/forcedotcom/cli
-->

### Summary
I GET BELOW ERROR WHEN I TRY TO AUTHORISE ORG
TypeError: shellPath.at is not a function

### Steps To Reproduce:

1. CREATE A PROJECT WITH MANIFEST
2. AUTHORIZE AN ORG

### Expected result
It should have redirected to a web page to authorise an org

### Actual result
Getting below error
TypeError: shellPath.at is not a function

### Additional information

![image](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/108812920/b459f5ee-39e7-4232-98eb-7a57bb1f9946)

**Salesforce Extension Version in VS Code**: 59.1.2

**SFDX CLI Version**: 2.14.6

**OS and version**: mac OS Ventura 13.5

**VS Code version**: 1.83

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -290,7 +290,9 @@ export const messages = {
   error_parsing_sfdx_project_file:
     "Couldn't parse sfdx-project.json file (%s). Parse error: %s",
   sfdx_cli_not_found:
-    'Salesforce CLI is not installed. Install it from [%s](%s)',
+    'Either Salesforce CLI is not installed or only SF v1 is present. Install the latest CLI version from [%s](%s)',
comment.body: I changed the error message because SF v1 does not map sf commands to sfdx and thus cannot be used by our extensions.  The isCliInstalled() function in cliConfiguration.ts uses "which sfdx" for the checking, which means having only SF v1 is caught at the same time as having no CLI installed.

pull_request.title: fix: validate CLI installation and version during activation of CLI Integration extension
pull_request.body:
<!--- PR title should follow the pattern: <type>(optional scope): <description>.
please refer to the types and format here: https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#summary
If this is a feat/fix, add the technical writer as a reviewer to the PR. --->

### What does this PR do?
This PR includes new functionality to check whether a supported CLI version is installed on the user's computer.  If there is no CLI installed or they have an unsupported version, the CLI Integration extension will not activate, and the user will not be able to see SFDX commands in the command palette.  The user will receive an error notification about the unsupported/missing CLI when the activation of the CLI Integration extension fails.

### What issues does this PR fix or reference?
@W-14196710@

### Functionality Before
As a result of the recent switch from SFDX -> SF-style variables to get rid of warnings in the Output tab, users with a CLI version below SFDX v7.193.2 are no longer able to use the extensions because older CLI versions do not support SF-style variables.
![Screenshot 2023-10-24 at 7 00 13 PM](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/139700604/89f28de1-15d2-4ca9-ad97-a2ce647b6b68)

### Functionality After
If the user does not have CLI installed on their computer or their installed CLI version is no longer supported, they will get an error notification when they first create/open a Salesforce Project and the CLI Integration extension will not activate.
![Screenshot 2023-10-25 at 11 53 06 PM](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/139700604/4a9d95f5-326e-4c01-87d2-29cb8d0a9060)
![Screenshot 2023-10-25 at 11 51 15 PM](https://github.com/forcedotcom/salesforcedx-vscode/assets/139700604/12bde58c-4816-4e6e-8ef7-d38728470758)
